title: Course on Applying Universal Instructional Design (UID) to Improve Accessibility in Distance Education [Large-Scale]

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical concepts and experience with online learning platforms
context.additional_context: Applying UID (Universal Instructional Design) principles to improve accessibility in math education for working professionals, utilizing Moodle™ LMS in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners can improve the accessibility of online mathematics resources in at least three ways by applying UID principles
Learners can maintain at least 80% participation rates for hearing-impaired learners using real-time caption/interpreting tools during Zoom sessions
Learners can submit project deliverables addressing visual and cognitive accessibility issues using Moodle™ plugin modules (e.g., ATBar, MathJax)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
